sentences.sContent: Sometimes I find it hard to cope.
sentences.sCn: 有时候我觉得很难应付。

sentences.sContent: He coped quite well as manager while still captaining the team.
sentences.sCn: 他是球队的主教练，同时兼任队长，干得相当好。

sentences.sContent: ...These arethings fast-food firms have learnt to cope with...
...Fast-food finns may not be able to cope with pressures from food regulation in the near future...
...What should American college students do to cope with their heavy reading assignments...

exam.question: The United States is trying to _______ the serious problems created by the energy crisis.

answer.explain: 句意： 美国正努力应对由于能源危机而产生的严重问题。 put up with： 忍受， 容忍； submit to： 服从于， 屈服于； comply with： 照…办。

trans.tranOther: to succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation
